## Books
Notes for books we have read can be found in Chapter \@ref(readingnotes).

- Data Feminism [@dignazio_data_2020], notes in Ch \@ref(datafem)
- Race After Technology: Abolitionist Tools for the New Jim Code [@benjamin_race_2019], notes in Ch \@ref(raceaftertech)
- Weapons of Math Destruction: How Big Data Increases Inequality and Threatens Democracy [@oneil_weapons_2016], notes in Ch \@ref(womd)



- Algorithms of Oppression: How Search Engines Reinforce Racism [@noble_algorithms_2018]
- Automating Inequality: How High-Tech Tools Profile, Police, and Punish the Poor [@eubanks_automating_2018]
- Invisible Women: Exposing Data Bias in a World Designed for Men [@perez_invisible_2019]
- Medical Apartheid: A Dark History of Medical Experimentation on Black Americans from Colonial Times to the Present [@washington_medical_2008]
- Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teachings of Plants [@kimmerer_braiding_2015]
- The Hospital: Life, Death, and Dollars in a Small American Town [@alexander_hospital_2021]
